page_verify.wrong_code: Unfortunately, this code is not valid. Try registering again or use a different link.

page_wait_verify.question_title: For the best experience, weâ€™d like to ask you three things.
page_wait_verify.preferences_text: Which conversations would you like to have right now? You can always change your preferences later.
page_wait_verify.preferences_no_content: Are you sure you want to continue without saving your preferences? No problem at all. It's great to have such broad interests!
page_wait_verify.verify_email: Now you only need to verify your email address. Youâ€™ve received an email with a link. Click it and youâ€™re all set.
page_wait_verify.code_valid: Thank you. Your email has been verified.
page_wait_verify.code_invalid: Unfortunately, this is not the correct code
page_wait_verify.code_expired: Unfortunately, your code has expired. You can request a new code
page_wait_verify.step_0_text: Would you like to confirm your email address before we proceed? You should have received an email with a code. Please enter it here.
page_wait_verify.step_1_text: To provide you with the best experience, weâ€™d like to ask you a few questions. First, your first name.
page_wait_verify.step_2_text: What do you primarily want to use AliciaLabs for? (multiple answers possible)
page_wait_verify.step_3_text: In what situations do you want to use this? (multiple answers possible)
page_wait_verify.step_4_text: How good are you at having conversations?
page_wait_verify.step_5_text: Weâ€™ll take your preferences into account, but weâ€™d like to make a suggestion to start with. Which situation would you like to try out?
page_wait_verify.step_6_text_people_with_other_opinion: What would you like to talk about?
page_wait_verify.step_6_text_colleagues: Whatâ€™s the topic of the conversation?
page_wait_verify.step_6_text_customer: What kind of company are you a customer of?
page_wait_verify.step_6_text_citizen: Which organization are you in contact with?
page_wait_verify.step_6_text_my_profession: What kind of work do you do?
page_wait_verify.step_6_text_open_for_unknown: What would you like to be surprised by?
page_wait_verify.step_7_text_single: Great ðŸ˜„! You can get started. We recommend starting with the conversation below.
page_wait_verify.step_7_text: Great ðŸ˜„! You can get started. We recommend starting with one of the conversations below.
page_wait_verify.skip_suggestion_title: Not quite what you were looking for?
page_wait_verify.skip_suggestion_text: You can also search for other conversations if you prefer.
page_wait_verify.skip_suggestion_popup: While weâ€™d love to help you, we also want to give you the freedom to choose for yourself. You can skip our suggestion and search for a conversation yourself. Have fun!

But no worries.

If youâ€™re sure that '{email}' is your email address, weâ€™ll accept this confirmation as well.

page_account.credits_how_text:
Credits are used to have conversations in the app. The consumption of credits is linked to the data usage of the AI agents. How many credits you need depends on how long a conversation lasts and how many help lines you enable.

A comprehensive conversation usually costs 200 to 300 credits. This can be slightly more or less, depending on the situation and which options you choose. A shorter, simple conversation costs about 100 credits.

When you registered, you received free credits. You can buy extra credits here, or choose a subscription that allows you to have unlimited conversations.

Credits are valid for 1 year from the date of purchase.
page_account.credits_how_button: See here exactly how much the different options cost.
page_account.offer_code_success: The code has been accepted and you now have extra credits.
page_account.offer_code_failure: The code is invalid or has already been used. Please try again with a different code.
page_account.become_trainer_text: Do you want to use AliciaLabs for your own training? Then become a trainer. You can create, publish, and manage your own cases and training.
page_account.trainer_basic_text: Create and publish your own cases and training. No registration fees. Pay per training.
page_account.trainer_pro_text: For more options and unlimited access to advanced features.
page_account.trainer_enterprise_text: For organizations that want to use AliciaLabs for their employees.
page_account.credits_buy_info:
Good for {conversations} good conversations
Select from all topics
Valid for 1 year
Personal dashboard

cases.change_category_message: The opening message has been changed to the default of the category
cases.title: Title
cases.case_content: Extra instructions for the AI conversation partner
cases.case_knowledge: Extra instructions for feedback and evaluation
cases.user_options: What can a user enter and use?
cases.user_help: What help can the user call upon?
cases.user_hide: What is visible to the user?
cases.no_case_yet: The case has (not) yet content. Not necessary, but if you want to practice a more specific situation, you can describe or generate the case here.
cases.name: Name
cases.no_connected_modules: This item is not yet connected to a module.
cases.check_incomplete: The following fields have not been filled in:
cases.case_copied_to_trainer: The case has been copied to your trainer's environment. You can edit it there.
cases.import_case_info: You can import cases from your own environment to AliciaLabs. Go to the cases in your own environment. Click on the case you want to use and click on the import button. The case will then be imported into AliciaLabs. You can edit the case there.
cases.generate_photo_standard_input: A centered portrait of a middle-aged caucasian woman teacher who looks happy.
cases.generate_photo_standard_instructions: The person is positioned in the center of the frame. The personâ€™s hairstyle, clothing, and any accessories are chosen creatively by the AI. The background is soft, neutral, and simple (e.g., soft gray or light beige). The face is well-lit with a natural expression, and the portrait is in a photo-realistic style. No text, lines, or other elements should be present in the image besides the portrait.
cases.generate_photo_standard_info: Set instructions for the AI to generate a photo. The more detailed the instructions, the better the result. You can also use the standard input as a starting point.
cases.no_voice_selected: No voice selected. The user cannot use the voice function.

modules.no_connected_items: This module has no items yet.
modules.new_training_name: What is the name of the new training?
modules.cannot_add_module_to_itself: An infinite loop would occur if you add this module to itself. Please choose another module.
modules.training_content_title: Detailed description of the training. Only displayed for a main module.

trainings.error_import_emails: Errors occurred while importing the email addresses. Check the file and try again.
trainings.editing_training: You are currently editing an item in the training
trainings.costs_extra_period: Extra month(s) (in addition to the standard 2 months)
trainings.type_credits_period: Credits are valid for the duration of the training (max 1 year)
trainings.no_connected_items: This part of the training has no items yet.
trainings.close_training_verify: Are you sure you want to close this training? Participants will no longer be able to follow the training. This cannot be undone.
trainings.close_training_verify_elearning: Are you sure you want to close this e-training? Participants will no longer be able to purchase or activate the e-training. Users who already have the training can continue to use it. Closing cannot be undone.
trainings.date_before_publish: Choose a date for when the training should be available.
trainings.creation_training_complete: The training has been created. You can now add participants to the training.
trainings.creation_training_complete_organisation: The training has been published. Employees will have access to the training from the start date.
trainings.code_generated: The registration code has been generated. You can now share it with the participants.
trainings.training_added: Training has been added to your account. You can start the training now.
trainings.training_pending: Training has been added to your account. The trainer still needs to approve access.
trainings.max_participants_reached: The maximum number of participants has been reached. If you want to add more participants, you need to increase the number of participants in the Credit Management of the training.
trainings.no_progress: There is no progress in this training yet.
trainings.price_elearning: Determine the price of your e-learning per user excl. VAT
trainings.elearning_margin_alicialabs: AliciaLabs margin is 20% of the price.
trainings.elearning_publish_marketplace_title: Publish your training on our Marketplace
trainings.elearning_publish_marketplace_descriptio:
Your training will be visible to organizations and users for direct purchase for 1 year. You can set the price yourself and receive 80% of the proceeds from this price. We take care of the marketing for AliciaLabs and the payment process for you.
Users will be separately asked if they want to purchase indefinite credits to follow the training if they do not have them yet.
trainings.elearning_publish_private_title: Use (also) your own channel to sell your training
trainings.elearning_publish_private_description:
You can invite users to participate in your training through your own channels. You set the price entirely yourself and the proceeds are yours. After publishing, a direct link will appear that you can give to users.
Users will automatically receive credits to follow the training. The amount (and the associated costs) can be set below. These will be charged to you as a trainer. You will receive a consolidated invoice for this monthly.
trainings.elearning_private_url_info: Send this link to users who may gain access to the training.
trainings.max_customers:
How many customers may use this link?
(0 = unlimited)
trainings.max_users_total:
How many users may be linked to this training?
(0 = unlimited)
trainings.max_users: How many users is this training for?
trainings.allowed_domains:
Which domains may use this link? (e.g. yourcompany.nl)
Leave empty for all domains. Separate multiple domains with commas.
trainings.allowed_domains_sales:
Are there specific domains allowed for users? (e.g. yourcompany.nl)
Fill in the last part of the email address if you want to allow a specific domain. Leave empty for all domains. Separate multiple domains with commas.
trainings.link_copied: The link has been copied to your clipboard.
trainings.link_not_copied: The link could not be copied to your clipboard. Please copy it manually.
trainings.elearning_created: The e-learning has been created. You can now share it with users.
trainings.add_invoice_address: You have not yet provided an invoice address. Please add it in your organization details.
trainings.price_elearning_org_min: Determine the minimum price for an organization (excl. VAT)
trainings.price_elearning_org_max: Determine the maximum price for an organization (excl. VAT)
trainings.elearning_organisation_price_info: Organizations that want to purchase this training pay the price per person excl. VAT x the number of employees with a minimum and maximum amount as indicated by you.
trainings.private_autorenew:
Do you want this training to be automatically renewed after 1 year?
No costs will be charged for an organization. For an individual user, an amount of â‚¬ 25,- will be charged for the credits.
trainings.amount_credits_unlimited: This amount will be charged to you as a trainer. With this amount, each participant has unlimited credits for one year to conduct conversations in the training.
trainings.amount_credits_4k: This amount will be charged to you as a trainer when the training is activated with the link below. With this amount, each participant has 4000 credits for one year to conduct conversations in the training. That is approximately 15-20 extensive conversations.
trainings.amount_credits: How much in credits do you want to make available per participant?
trainings.publish_for_all_employees_info: To make the training available to employees, you must publish the training. After publication, all employees of your organization will have access to the training.
trainings.publish_for_some_employees: Publish for a selection of employees
trainings.publish_for_some_employees_info: You can also determine which employees have access to the training. You can then add participants to the training yourself after publication.
trainings.publish_for_participants_info: To make the training available to participants, you must publish the training. After publication, you can link the participants or create a participation link.
trainings.publish_marketplace_info: Your training will be visible to organizations and users for direct purchase for 1 year. You can set the price yourself and receive 80% of the proceeds from this price. We take care of the marketing for AliciaLabs and the payment process for you.
trainings.publish_stream_info:
With a stream, users can practice cases directly without having to create an account. These cases can be embedded in e-learning or websites.
To facilitate the stream, you purchase a credit package for the training.
trainings.sell_directly_participants_known: I have the details of the participants
trainings.sell_directly_participants_known_info: You select the customer yourself and add the participants directly. You then determine the price and activate the training directly for the participants. The invoice is sent to the customer and the participants receive an invitation.
trainings.sell_directly_amount_known: I only know how many participants are involved
trainings.sell_directly_amount_known_info: You only know how many participants are involved, but not who. You select the customer yourself and specify the number of participants. You then determine the price and activate the training directly for the participants. The invoice is sent to the customer. You receive a link that you or the customer can give to the participants to register.
trainings.sell_directly_variable_amount: The number of participants is not yet known
trainings.sell_directly_variable_amount_info: You do not yet know how many participants will be involved. You select the customer yourself and specify a maximum number of participants (if there is a maximum) and an end date. You then determine the price per participant and any base price. The invoice with a base price is sent to the customer. You receive a link that you or the customer can give to the participants to register. At the end of each month, the customer receives an invoice for the actual number of participants for that month.
trainings.publish_select: Publishing can be done in various ways. Choose the method that best suits this training.
trainings.marketplace_extra_sales_info: Add any extra e-trainings of yours for this training on the Marketplace here. These extra sales options will be shown at checkout to organizations and users who want to purchase the training.

generate_case.description_questions: The questions below provide input for creating the case. The more information you provide here, the better the conversation will be simulated. Except for the role, the data is not mandatory.
generate_case.description_summary: Generate the case and check if your case has been interpreted correctly. You can also adjust it.
generate_case.role_question: What role should the conversation partner (AI) take on?
generate_case.name_ai_question: If you want to give the AI conversation partner a specific name, you can indicate that here. If you leave this blank, our AI will choose a name itself if applicable.
generate_case.case_issue_question: Describe the case / issue. As detailed as possible.
generate_case.role_user_question: Describe from which role the user is approaching the conversation.
generate_case.function_question: What is the function of the person and what role does he/she play in relation to the problem?
generate_case.vision_question: How does this person view the issue / case?
generate_case.interests_question: What is important to this person in relation to the problem? Does he/she have specific questions and/or concerns?
generate_case.communication_style: How would you like the AI conversation partner to communicate?
generate_case.communication_style_question_case: How would you like the AI conversation partner to communicate? Name one or more characteristics.
generate_case.communication_style_question: Here you can describe the way the AI conversation partner communicates in addition to the attitude score. Choose one or more of the displayed characteristics, or provide your own description under 'other'.
generate_case.external_factors: Are there external factors that influence the input or attitude of the AI conversation partner?
generate_case.external_factors_question: Here you can indicate circumstances that influence the AI conversation partner. For example, the AI conversation partner has a home situation in which he/she has to provide a lot of informal care (in an assessment interview) or the AI is sensitive to what others think of him/her.
generate_case.history: Have there been previous interactions and how did they go?
generate_case.history_question: Here you can indicate something about any previous interactions if there have been any. This allows the AI to build on those previous interactions, making the conversation more realistic for the user.
generate_case.attitude_question: How should the AI conversation partner behave towards the user?
generate_case.steadfastness_question: How firmly should the AI conversation partner adhere to his/her opinion and/or values? (1=accepts everything, 10=always sticks to own opinion)

specifics.application_help_1: Indicate the function and the organization. You can also provide a link to the website of the organization or function.
specifics.application_help_2: Here you can indicate specific job requirements or selection criteria, for example.
specifics.application_question_1: What position, in which (type of) organization is it?
specifics.application_question_2: What is important for the AI conversation partner?
specifics.assessment_help_1: NB: in the roles for the AI and the student, it must be clear who the supervisor is who evaluates the other.
specifics.assessment_help_2: If the AI is the supervisor, you can indicate here what the supervisor will evaluate. If the AI is the evaluated, you can indicate what is important for this employee, such as a pleasant working environment, sufficient free time, etc.
specifics.assessment_question_1: What position, in which (type of) organization is it?
specifics.assessment_question_2: What is important for the AI conversation partner?
specifics.client_help_1: Give the topic of the conversation, for example a disease, an operation, a stay in a care center, etc.
specifics.client_help_2: Indicate how the AI conversation partner views the topic of conversation.
specifics.client_question_1: What is the topic of conversation?
specifics.client_question_2: What is the vision of the AI conversation partner?
specifics.coaching_help_1: The AI is the one who will be coached. Indicate what the coaching question of the AI is. The student can then practice his or her coaching skills.
specifics.coaching_question_1: What is the question of the AI conversation partner?
specifics.complaint_conversation_help_1: Indicate the product or service that the complaint is about.
specifics.complaint_conversation_help_2: Describe the content of the complaint.
specifics.conflict_help_1: Describe what the conflict is about.
specifics.conflict_help_2: Describe how the AI conversation partner views it, for example what the AI conversation partner wants the other person to do or not do.
specifics.conflict_question_2: What is the vision of the AI conversation partner?
specifics.consultation_help_1: The AI is the one who will be advised. Indicate what the AI wants advice on, so that the student can practice his or her advisory skills.
specifics.consultation_question_1: What is the question of the AI conversation partner?
specifics.customer_help_1: Describe what product or service it is about.
specifics.customer_help_2: If the AI is the customer, you can indicate here what is important to the customer, such as good service, a well-functioning product, etc. If the AI is the supplier, it is important to retain or satisfy the customer.
specifics.customer_question_1: What is the product or service?
specifics.customer_question_2: What is important for the AI conversation partner?
specifics.debate_help_1: Provide a topic or a statement.
specifics.debate_help_2: Indicate what position the AI conversation partner takes.
specifics.debate_question_2: What is the vision of the AI conversation partner?
specifics.feedback_help_1: Clearly indicate whether the feedback is about the role of the AI conversation partner or whether the student is going to practice receiving feedback.
specifics.feedback_help_2: Indicate how the AI conversation partner views the topic of conversation.
specifics.feedback_question_1: What is the topic of feedback?
specifics.feedback_question_2: What is the vision of the AI conversation partner?
specifics.introduction_question_1: What is the background of the AI conversation partner?
specifics.negotiation_help_1: Indicate what the negotiation is about, for example the purchase of the house, division of tasks in the household, salary etc.
specifics.negotiation_help_2: Indicate what the AI conversation partner wants to achieve in the negotiation.
specifics.negotiation_question_1: What is the topic of negotiation?
specifics.negotiation_question_2: What is important for the AI conversation partner?
specifics.personal_help_1: Indicate what the conversation will be about.
specifics.personal_help_2: Indicate how the AI conversation partner views this topic and/or what he/she would like regarding this topic.
specifics.personal_question_2: What is the vision of the AI conversation partner?
specifics.sales_help_1: Indicate the product or service that is being sold.
specifics.sales_help_2: Indicate what is important for the AI conversation partner in the sales process.
specifics.sales_question_1: What is the product or service?
specifics.sales_question_2: What do you want to convey about what is important for the AI conversation partner?
specifics.transformative_help_1: Indicate what topic where different views exist will be discussed.
specifics.transformative_help_2: Indicate what position the AI conversation partner takes on this topic.
specifics.transformative_question_1: What is the topic of conversation?
specifics.transformative_question_2: What is the vision of the AI conversation partner?
specifics.deep_help_1: Indicate what topic will be discussed.
specifics.deep_help_2: Indicate how the AI conversation partner views this topic.
specifics.deep_question_1: What is the topic of conversation?
specifics.deep_question_2: What is the vision of the AI conversation partner?
specifics.work_help_1: Indicate what the conversation will be about.
specifics.work_help_2: Indicate how the AI conversation partner views this topic.
specifics.work_question_2: What is the vision of the AI conversation partner?
specifics.expert_question_1: Which expertise does the AI conversation partner have?
specifics.expert_question_2: Is there specific knowledge that the AI conversation partner needs to obtain from the internet? Please provide the URL(s) here.
specifics.expert_help_1: The AI conversation partner is an expert in a specific field. Indicate which expertise the AI conversation partner has.
specifics.expert_help_2: If the AI conversation partner needs specific knowledge, you can provide the URLs where the AI conversation partner can find this knowledge. The AI conversation partner will use this knowledge to conduct the conversation. This could be a website with information about the topic of the conversation, or a specific page with information about the AI conversation partner itself.
specifics.examinator_question_2: What are the assessment criteria, or when has the user demonstrated sufficient knowledge?
specifics.examinator_help_1: The AI conversation partner is an examiner who tests the user's knowledge. Indicate which knowledge is being tested.
specifics.examinator_help_2: Indicate what the assessment criteria are, or when the user has demonstrated sufficient knowledge.

conversation.analyzing_text: Weâ€™re analyzing your feedback and using it to improve our services.
conversation.analysis_ready: Your analysis is ready. Would you like to answer the question now?
conversation.feedback_reality: Weâ€™re curious how realistic the conversation felt to you. How realistic was it?
conversation.thanks_wait: Thanks. Please hold on a moment...
conversation.choices_text: Here are a few possible responses to help you get started.
conversation.close_text:
Do you want to end the conversation completely and receive feedback on it?
Or would you like to continue later?
conversation.end_error: Something went wrong when ending the conversation. Please try again later.
conversation.sound_error: Something went wrong when converting speech to text. Please try again later.
conversation.background_error: Something went wrong while fetching the background information. Please try again later.
conversation.choices_error: Something went wrong while retrieving suggestions. Please try again later.
conversation.facts_error: Something went wrong while retrieving facts. Please try again later.
conversation.menu_choices: Give me some suggestions on what to say
conversation.menu_facts: Check the facts mentioned for me
conversation.menu_phases: How did the conversation phases go?
conversation.menu_goal: What is the goal of the conversation again?

pdf.ready: The document has been generated and is being downloaded.
pdf.disclaimer_text:
This report is based on a conversation with an AI-simulated conversation partner within AliciaLabs. The conversation partner may carry a fictional or real name, but the dialogue was entirely generated by artificial intelligence.

The statements and viewpoints in this report do not originate from any real individual and should not be attributed to any actual person. AliciaLabs is not liable for the content of the generated conversation and accepts no responsibility for any conclusions drawn or actions taken based on this report.

conversation.disclaimer_ai: This is an AI simulation conversation. The statements displayed cannot be attributed to real people.
conversation.no_skills_points_length: Your conversation was too short to earn points for conversation skills.
conversation.first_wait_message: Your conversation partner is getting ready to talk to you...
conversation.first_wait_message_voice: Your conversation partner is getting ready to talk to you
conversation.days_between_conversations: Number of days between this and the previous conversation?
conversation.actions_between_conversations: Has anything happened between this and the previous conversation?
conversation.next_conversation_explanation: Simulate a continuation of this conversation. You can start a new conversation with the same AI conversation partner and build on the previous conversation. This can help deepen the relationship with the AI conversation partner and gain more insight into the situation.
conversation.conversation_closed: This conversation has been closed. You can find it in your completed cases to review or continue the discussion.

conversation_start.goal_instructions: What is your goal for the conversation? (What do you want to discuss or achieve as a result?)
conversation_start.starting_instructions: Indicate how you want to start the conversation. Your conversation partner will respond to this directly as the beginning of the conversation.
conversation_start.opening_user: Adjust the opening below, if you want.

useOptions.my_understanding: I want to be better understood
useOptions.others_understanding: I want to better understand others
useOptions.achieve_conversation: I want to achieve more in conversations
useOptions.benefit_conversation: I want to get more out of conversations
useOptions.solve_problem: I want to solve a problem

experienceOptions.compliments: I get a lot of compliments

share.basic_site:
`Do you know AliciaLabs yet?
I'm going to try this out.
With AliciaLabs, you can simulate realistic conversations and get immediate feedback. You get 300 free credits upon registration! Try it out at https://www.alicialabs.com/
share.basic_text_case:
Do you know AliciaLabs yet?
I've just practiced the interesting conversation below:

[case_title].
[case_user_info].

Would you like to practice this situation too and improve your conversation skills? With AliciaLabs, you can simulate realistic conversations and get immediate feedback. You get 300 free credits upon registration! Try it out here [case_link].

tooltips.case_title_user_info: Here you give the case a title and a short explanation. This information will appear on the title page and is intended for the user. It is not input for the AI conversation partner.
tooltips.case_user_info: Write a short explanation of the case here. For example, what the case is about or what you can practice with it. This will be shown on the title page.
tooltips.case_basics: This section is about the basic data of the case and the role of the AI conversation partner.
tooltips.case_conversationtype: Choose what type of conversation you want to have in the case. Each type has phases or elements that are used for support functions such as feedback, suggestions, and conversation progress.
tooltips.case_role: Briefly describe the role of the AI conversation partner, for example with an indication such as: manager, doctor, hippie, mother, etc.
tooltips.case_level:
Indicate how difficult the case is (1 = easy, 5 = difficult). This helps the user, but does not affect the behavior of the AI. Difficulty depends on:
  • Low attitude = harder
  • High steadfastness = harder
  • Complex or loaded topic = harder
tooltips.case_connected_modules: Select the modules in which you want to use the case. This can also be done later here or when editing a module. Leave this field blank if you don't know yet in which modules you want to use the case.
tooltips.case_photo: Add an image here: upload a file yourself, take a photo, or have one generated with AI (the latter costs 5 credits).
tooltips.case_extra_instructions:
Based on the data in 'Basics', the AI conversation partner can already conduct a conversation. Here you can provide additional instructions. If you don't do that, the AI conversation partner will fill in appropriate details based on the indicated role, attitude, and steadfastness. Each user will then receive a slightly different case.
The more content you add here, the more everyone will get the same case. You can add content in two ways:
  • Write it yourself
  • Use the instruction wizard to generate an additional instruction with your input
Tip: use the instruction wizard the first time to see what an additional instruction might look like. You can always adjust this manually later.

Note: In 'What can a user enter themselves' you can add 'free questions' for users. These are questions that are asked to the user at the start of a conversation. This allows cases to be tailored to the user's situation. If you want to use that, only give instructions here that always apply to your case (and are not contradictory or limiting to the information in the free questions).

Note: The instruction wizard only works if a conversation type has been chosen, because the required input differs per conversation type. The conversation type can be chosen under 'Basics'.

Important: write your instructions as an order to the AI. So, for example: 'you are a patient and you are going to have a conversation with a doctor about an investigation into certain medical complaints of yours.' If you provide information about the human conversation partner, you write about this in terms of 'The user'.
tooltips.case_extra_knowledge: Our AI agents who specialize in providing feedback, suggestions, and evaluations already have a lot of knowledge. You can optionally select additional knowledge that the AI agents can use. You can add this knowledge yourself in your organization under 'Specific Knowledge'.
tooltips.case_user_input_options: Here you can indicate what the user can enter themselves. If you turn on the 'sliders', the user can adjust your suggestion at the start of a conversation. Always make a suggestion for an opening message as a trainer, so that the user is helped on their way.
tooltips.case_user_help_options: Indicate which functions may be available to the user during the conversation: receive suggestions, use fact-check, request background information, and/or undo last response.
tooltips.case_user_hide_options: Indicate which elements should be hidden from the user. This can be useful if you don't want the user to know the attitude of the AI conversation partner or receive direct feedback during the conversation.
tooltips.case_opening_message: To start the conversation, the user must enter an opening message. This is a suggestion for the user. You can adjust this if you want.
tooltips.case_goal: What is the goal of the conversation? (What do you want to discuss or achieve as a result?)
tooltips.case_free_input:
Here you can add one or more free questions. At the beginning of a conversation, the user will be asked these questions. This allows the user to provide input so that the case is specifically tailored to their own situation. For example:
  • Who are you going to talk to?
  • What are you going to talk about?
  • What is this person's vision on the topic of conversation?
  • What is this person's communication style?
tooltips.case_name_ai: Here you can give the AI conversation partner a specific name, or leave this blank so that the AI conversation partner chooses a name itself.
tooltips.case_role_user: Here you can indicate the role of the user. You can leave this blank if the user does not have a specific role.
tooltips.case_type_specific_input: Here you can provide input that fits the chosen conversation type. The clearer your input, the more concrete the additional instructions for the AI conversation partner will be. The conversation simulation will then better match what you have in mind.
tooltips.case_advanced: Here you can give the case even more specific content.
tooltips.case_communication_style: Here you can indicate characteristics of the communication style of the AI conversation partner in addition to the attitude score. Choose one or more of the displayed characteristics, or fill something in yourself under 'other'.
tooltips.case_attitude: This value determines the attitude of the AI conversation partner at the beginning of the conversation. Use the slider to set this. To the right of the slider, the set value is characterized by a word. The lower the attitude, the harder the conversation. During the conversation, the attitude can change depending on the behavior of the user. You can indicate more characteristics about the communication style of the AI conversation partner in 'additional instructions'.
tooltips.case_steadfastness: This value determines how steadfast the AI conversation partner is to his/her own vision. The higher the steadfastness, the harder it is to change the AI's mind. Tip: if you want a challenging case, set this at least at 70.
tooltips.case_external_factors: Here you can provide input about external factors that influence the behavior of the AI conversation partner. For example, something may be going on in the home situation of the AI conversation partner, or the AI conversation partner may be sensitive to the opinion of someone else, etc. You can also leave this blank.
tooltips.case_history: Here you can provide input about any previous interactions between the user and the AI conversation partner. Leave this blank if there have been no previous interactions.
tooltips.case_instructions:
The AI now generates the additional instructions for the AI conversation partner based on your input. You can:
  • Go back and edit your input, and have the instructions generated again
  • Manually edit the instructions
  • Save the instructions so that they become part of the case
Tip: Check whether the roles of the AI conversation partner and the user have been interpreted correctly. In the instruction, 'you' should refer to the AI conversation partner. The user should be referred to as 'user'.
tooltips.info_item_title_user_info: Here you give the knowledge item a title and a short explanation. This information will appear on the title page and is intended for the user. Nothing from a knowledge item is input for the AI conversation partner.
tooltips.info_item_user_info: Write a short explanation of the knowledge item here. For example, a sentence that makes you curious to open the knowledge item. This is shown on the title page of the knowledge item.
tooltips.info_item_title_photo: This photo is visible on the title page. You can upload a photo, take one, choose from our library, or have it generated by AI (the latter costs 5 credits).
tooltips.info_item_content: In this block you fill in the knowledge item content. This is the information that users will see when they open the knowledge item.
tooltips.info_item_type: Select the medium you want to use. If you want to upload a video, you must select 'video' here. You can also provide text with it. If you choose 'text', you can add an image in addition to text.
tooltips.info_item_connected_modules: Select the modules in which you want to use the knowledge item. This can also be done later here or when editing a module. Leave this field blank if you don't know yet in which modules you want to use the knowledge item.
tooltips.info_item_intro:
Here you can enter a short introduction text to introduce the video or image. After the video or image, you can provide more explanation (if you want).

Note: this content is what the user sees.
tooltips.info_item_video: Here you can add a video. You can upload a video or enter a YouTube or Vimeo link.
tooltips.info_item_image: Here you can add an image. You can upload a photo, take one, choose from our library, or have it generated by AI (the latter costs 5 credits).
tooltips.info_item_body_text:
Here you can add an explanation text or, for example, reflection questions or assignments for the user.

Note: When you copy and paste text from somewhere, sometimes formatting is unintentionally included. You can remove this formatting by selecting the text and clicking on Tx.
tooltips.info_item_files: Here you can add files that the user will be able to download.
tooltips.module_title_user_info: Here you give the module a title and a short explanation. This information will appear on the title page and is intended for the user. This is not input for the AI conversation partner.
tooltips.module_user_info: Write a short explanation of the module here. For example, a sentence that makes you curious to open the module. This is shown on the title page of the module.
tooltips.module_title_photo: This photo is visible on the title page. You can upload a photo, take one, choose from our library, or have it generated by AI (the latter costs 5 credits).
tooltips.module_make_training:
The module is converted into a training. The content of the module is then copied to a training. If you then make any changes to a case or knowledge item within the training, those changes will only be saved in the training.

Changes to your modules, cases, and knowledge items have no effect on a training.

You can also add participants to a training after you have published it.
tooltips.module_elements: Here you see all cases, knowledge items, and other modules that are part of this module. Have you just created a new module? Then it will be visible here after saving.
tooltips.training_title_user_info: Here you give the training a title and a short explanation. This information will appear on the title page and is intended for the user. This is not input for the AI conversation partner. If you created the training from a module, the title information of that module is already displayed here. You can adjust this if you want.
tooltips.training_user_info: Write a short explanation of the training here. For example, a sentence that makes you curious to open the training. This is shown on the title page of the module.
tooltips.training_title_photo: This photo is visible on the title page. You can upload a photo, take one, choose from our library, or have it generated by AI (the latter costs 5 credits).
tooltips.training_elements: Here you can select modules, cases, and knowledge items and make them part of the training. If you created the training from a module, the content of that module is already displayed here. If you make changes here, they will no longer be saved in the original cases, knowledge items, and modules. If something is placed in a training, a copy is made for that specific training.
tooltips.training_publish: To open the training for participants, you must publish the training. After publication, you can link the participants or create a participation link.
tooltips.training_intro_publish: There are costs associated with opening a training for participants. These costs depend on the number of participants.
tooltips.training_intro_publish_elearning: Publishing an e-training does not incur direct costs. These depend on sales. Set below how you want to sell the e-training.
tooltips.training_intro_publish_organisation: To open the training for employees, you must publish the training. After publication, all employees of your organization will have access to the training.
tooltips.training_intro_publish_organisation_and_: To open the training for employees, you must publish the training. After publication, all employees of your organization will have access to the training. You can also open the training for participants outside your organization, but then you must publish the training as a trainer. There are costs associated with this.
tooltips.training_costs_publish:
Basic amount
For each training, you pay a fixed basic amount of â‚¬100, unless you have a Trainer Pro package.

Unlimited use

  • Participants can practice with all cases in your training as long as the training is open.
  • Costs: â‚¬10 per participant for the first 2 months.
  • Do you want to keep the training open longer? Then you pay â‚¬5 per participant for each additional month.

Extra participants
You can always add extra participants or extend the opening during the training.
tooltips.training_costs_publish_trainer_pro:
Basic amount
As a Trainer Pro, you do not have basic costs per training.

Unlimited use

  • Participants can practice with all cases in your training as long as the training is open.
  • Costs: â‚¬10 per participant for the first 2 months.
  • Do you want to keep the training open longer? Then you pay â‚¬5 per participant for each additional month.

Extra participants
You can always add extra participants or extend the opening during the training.
tooltips.training_add_participants:
You can add participants to the training in three ways:

Add participants yourself

  • Click on the plus sign (+) and fill in the email addresses of the participants. If they register and log in to AliciaLabs with that email address, they will automatically gain access to the training.



Import participants

  • If you have a list of names and email addresses of the participants, you can import them. Click on 'import' and use the template to create a file in the correct format. Import that file. If they register and log in to AliciaLabs with that email address, they will automatically gain access to the training.


Send link to participants 🔗

  • You can also create an access link and send it to the participants. If they click on the link, they can register and log in to AliciaLabs and immediately gain access to the training. If someone is already logged in, the registration code within AliciaLabs can be used to gain access to the training.


Dashboard
tooltips.dashboard_trainer_info:
Your name, or organization name, and logo are displayed on the participants' dashboard. This is the name under which you are registered with AliciaLabs.

You can add an email address where participants can contact you if they have questions about the training. This email address is not shown to participants. If you do not fill in an address here, messages will be sent to the first Admin.

You can also provide a Description of yourself or your organization here. This will be displayed to participants when they click on your name or logo.
tooltips.training_available_date: This training or part of the training is available to participants from the set date. If this date is empty or in the past, then (this part of) the training is immediately available to participants.
tooltips.training_available_till: This training or part of the training is available to participants until the set date. If this date is empty, then (this part of) the training is available until the training is closed.
tooltips.module_tags: Here you can add tags to the module or training. These tags are used to categorize the module and can help in searching for modules.
tooltips.dashboard_admins: Here you can manage the trainers of the organization. Trainers have access to the trainer environment and can adjust settings and manage trainings.
tooltips.add_employee_info: Here you can enter an email address of someone you want to add as an employee to the organization.
tooltips.training_add_employees:
You can add employees to the organization in two ways:

Add employees yourself

Click on the plus sign (+) and fill in the email addresses of the employees.

Import employees

If you have a list of names and email addresses of the employees, you can import them. Click on 'import' and use the template to create a file in the correct format. Import that file.
tooltips.add_knowledge_item_text: Here you can add any extra specific knowledge that the AI can use when providing feedback in cases. Note: The AI already has a considerable knowledge base, so this is only necessary if you want to add specific knowledge that is not already in the AI.
tooltips.add_knowledge_expert_text: Here you can add knowledge that the AI can use in expert conversations. This knowledge is used by the AI conversation partner to coach the user and provide information during an expert conversation.
tooltips.training_content: Describe the content of the training in detail here. This will be displayed when the training is clicked on.
tooltips.trainer_details:
Provide more information about yourself or your organization here. This will be displayed when a user views your information.
This information can be found by clicking on your logo in your trainings.
tooltips.case_voice:
Here you can choose the voice of the AI conversation partner. You can choose from different voices. The voices may vary in accent, intonation, and speed.

The attitude of the AI conversation partner in the conversation can of course influence the way of speaking.

Try out different voices to see which one best fits your case.
tooltips.case_voice_on: Turn on this option if you want the AI conversation partner to respond with a voice instead of chat.
tooltips.welcome_message: Here you can enter a welcome message that users will receive via email when they sign up for the training.

dashboard.trainer_pro_required: For this function, you need an AliciaLabs Trainer Pro account.
dashboard.add_admin: Find a user to add as trainer
dashboard.request_amount_employees_text: You can adjust the number of employees. Indicate below what you want to adjust. You will then receive a customized quote.
dashboard.request_amount_admins_text: You can adjust the number of trainers. Indicate below what you want to adjust. You will then receive a customized quote.
dashboard.request_send_success: Your request has been sent. You will receive a quote as soon as possible.
dashboard.add_admin_error: Something went wrong while adding the trainer. Please try again later.
dashboard.search_admin_error: The user was not found. Please check the email address and try again.
dashboard.admin_deleted: The trainer has been successfully removed.
dashboard.search_admin_exists: This user is already an trainer.
dashboard.add_admin_employee_required: You can only add users who are already registered as an employee of the organization.
dashboard.max_admins_reached: The maximum number of trainers has been reached. You cannot add any new trainers.
dashboard.max_employees_reached: The maximum number of employees has been reached. You cannot add any new employees.
dashboard.add_knowledge_creating_summary: Our specialized AI is now creating a summary for our other AIs
dashboard.add_knowledge_item_text: Here you can add any extra specific knowledge that the AI can use when providing feedback in cases. Note: The AI already has a considerable knowledge base, so this is only necessary if you want to add specific knowledge that is not already in the AI.
dashboard.add_knowledge_item_instructions: Add your knowledge here. You can indicate at each case whether the AI may use this knowledge when providing feedback.
dashboard.add_knowledge_expert_text: Here you can add knowledge that the AI can use in expert conversations. This knowledge is used by the AI conversation partner to coach the user and provide information during an expert conversation.
dashboard.new_expert_knowledge_instructions:
Add your knowledge here. This knowledge will be used by the AI conversation partner to coach the user and provide information during an expert conversation. Provide a title, a summary of up to 1500 characters, and attach a .txt or .pdf file with the full knowledge.

NOTE: Make sure you do NOT include a table of contents or glossary in your attachment, unless this is specifically meant to be looked up. Otherwise, the AI may not find the right information.
dashboard.expert_knowledge_uploaded: Expert knowledge has been added. You can now select it for a case with the conversation type 'expert'.
dashboard.expert_knowledge_uploaded_extra: The extra knowledge has been added. This knowledge will also be used for this expert knowledge.
dashboard.knowledge_delete: Are you sure you want to delete this knowledge? If it is still selected for a case, it will no longer be available for the AI conversation partner. This cannot be undone.
dashboard.edit_expert_book_summary_instructions: Here you can edit the summary of the expert book. This summary is used by the AI conversation partner to coach the user and provide information during an expert conversation. The summary may contain a maximum of 1500 characters.
dashboard.expert_add_book_instructions: Add an extra document to the expert knowledge.
dashboard.trainer_details: Provide more information about yourself or your organization here.
dashboard.email: Email. Where users can contact you.
dashboard.embed_title: Place your e-trainings on your own website
dashboard.embed_text:
• Copy the embed code below. This code places the tool as an iframe on your own page.
  • Paste the code into the HTML of your website where you want the tool to be visible.
  • Save your page and reload. The tool will be automatically loaded and will always show the most up-to-date version. This embed code is privacy-friendly and automatically refreshes without caching.
  • You can adjust the width and height in the embed code if needed.
dashboard.show_credits_text: Show the text 'Incl. credits' in the price display in the marketplace.

marketplace.code_input: Enter the code you received from your trainer.
marketplace.add_unlimited_credits: To follow this training properly, you need credits. You can practice this training unlimitedly by taking a subscription with unlimited credits. Do you want unlimited practice with this (and all other) training for â‚¬ 25 per year?
marketplace.unlimited_credits: Yes, I would like unlimited credits for one year for â‚¬ 25.
marketplace.success_purchase: You have successfully purchased the training. It is now available in your dashboard. You will be redirected shortly.
marketplace.request_payout_verify: Are you sure you want to make a payout request? You cannot undo this request.
marketplace.payout_request_sent: Your payout request has been sent. We will process your request as soon as possible.
marketplace.bank_account_required: You have not provided a bank account yet. In order to make a payout, you must first add a bank account in your organization details.
marketplace.not_logged_in: Log in first or create an account to purchase trainings.
marketplace.activation_failed_code: The code is invalid or cannot be activated on your account.
marketplace.activation_failed_used: The code has already been used by the maximum number of users.
marketplace.activation_successful: The code has been successfully activated. The training is now available in your dashboard.
marketplace.activation_already_used: The training is already available in your dashboard.
marketplace.activation_not_private: This training cannot be activated with a code. You can purchase this training in the marketplace.
marketplace.confirm_purchase_organisation_text:
With the purchase of this training for your organization, all employees of your organization will have access to this training. The price is based on the number of employees in your organization.

Are you sure you want to purchase this training for your organization?
marketplace.no_trainer_details: The trainer has not yet provided any details about themselves or the organization.
marketplace.checking_code: We are checking your special code...
marketplace.code_not_found: The code is invalid or not found.
marketplace.no_private_item_found: This e-training is not found or not available without access code.

checkout.unlimited_credits_description: Practice unlimited with all cases in AliciaLabs.
checkout.unlimited_credits_already: You already have a subscription with unlimited credits.
checkout.login_failed: Login failed. The password is incorrect for this existing user.
checkout.disclaimer_alicialabs_platform: This training is offered through the AliciaLabs platform.

form.name: Name
form.is_company: I am purchasing on behalf of an organization

customers.add_customer_text: Create a new customer here. You can later link trainings to users for this customer.
customers.created_successfully: The customer has been successfully created.
customers.updated_successfully: The customer has been successfully updated.
customers.no_customers: There are no customers created yet.
customers.no_trainings: There are no trainings sold to this customer yet.
customers.training_and_invoice_sent: The invoice has been sent to the customer. The selected users now have access to the training and have received a notification.
customers.add_user_message: Add one or more users first.
customers.invalid_user_list: The user list is invalid. Please check the email addresses.
customers.select_customer: Select a customer first, or create a new one.
